wireworldevolver
Class CircuitBoard

java.lang.Object
  wireworldevolver.CircuitBoard

public class CircuitBoard
extends java.lang.Object

Representation of the board that Cells live in based on given BoardFileManager. Is used to select cells, and gives cells the knowledge of their neighbouring cells. Interacts with BoardFileManager to populate the board from file.

Version:
0.1
Author:
Jani Rahkola

Constructor Summary
CircuitBoard(BoardFileManager file)
          Creates a board that is based on file

Method Detail

getCellIn

public Cell getCellIn(int row,
                      int col)
Returns the Cell in row, col.

Parameters:
row - A row number of this board, starting from 0.
col - A column number of this board, starting from 0.
Returns:
The Cell in row, col position in board or null if Cell does not exist.

Tells wheter this board is already populated with Cells or not.

populateFromFile

public void populateFromFile(java.lang.String filePath)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Initializes the internal board and populates it with Cells based on a file denoted by filePath.

Parameters:
filePath - Full path to the file that this board will be based on.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
